Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a game-tying, two-run home run in the eighth inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead home run off Emmanuel Clase.
Jhonkensy Noel hit a game-tying home run in the ninth inning.
David Fry hit a walk-off two-run home run in the tenth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Guardians catcher Austin Hedges claimed Emmanuel Clase is the best pitcher in MLB history.
Yankees closer Luke Weaver had been performing exceptionally well, mimicking Mariano Rivera.
Post-Match Reflections: Luke Weaver expressed disappointment over the loss, acknowledging how close they were to a 3-0 lead.
Giancarlo Stanton commented on the sting of the loss but emphasized the need to move forward.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone will need to strategize for the next game with rookie Luis Gil starting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Aaron Judge's home run was the second-fastest home-to-home speed of his career.
Clay Holmes' scoreless streak in the postseason ended at 15 1/3 innings.
